MILTON - Over 30 exotic animals seized from a Milton home in December were turned over to the town after their owner failed to pay a security bond for their care, the executive director of an international humane society for exotic animals said.
The animals were seized from Linda Kastle's home on Dec. 31 after she had been hospitalized, Marlborough police said at the time. Police said seven monkeys, eight exotic birds, a prairie dog, 13 cats, four dogs, four tortoises, a squirrel and a rat were removed from the home.
